intro: Pimelea traversii subsp. boreus, commonly known as the southern banksia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in cone-like clusters. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. This subspecies is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
